Name: Planet Raiders
Description:
Planet Raiders is an abstract strategy game.

The action takes place on a space-like board with 4 planets at the peripheries (populated by aliens) and player's spaceships in the middle. The objective of the game is to recover the spaceships.

In order to do this each player has 3 raiders and 5 rockets. Using these he has to form the crew of the ship by making prisoners enemy's raiders and recovering aliens scattered on the planets.

Once a crew is formed, the player must be the first to bring one of his raiders on his ship to win.

Name: Anima Tactics: Macbeth
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Appointed by the Queen of Spades to destroy darkness no matter the form it takes, Macbeth is the newest of the Knights of Azriel. Just over a year ago his physical body was destroyed while protecting Lillian Virgil. Despite this, Macbeth’s spirit carries on as a large suit of armor manifesting quasi divine powers. Macbeth has put these powers and his dedication to the light at the service of the Girl Empress of Abel.

Warrior/Mystic - Light Empire - Level 55

Innate abilities: Damage Resistance, Immunity (Doom)
Destroyer of the Unholy: Macbeth's Attacks against dark units use his secondary Damage value.
Aegis: Macbeth uses his secondary Defense value against Ranged Attacks.
Immortal Breath: At the end of each Maintenance Phase, Macbeth or a friendly Unit within his control Zone gains Healing Lv1

Consecrate (Magic, Effect, Reactive) - A friendly unit within Macbeth's control zone gets +1 Attack, +1 Defense and +1 Resistance until the end of the turn. Limit: Once per Turn.

The Sword of Azrael (Ki, Attack) - This attack affects all enemy units within 2 inches of Macbeth.

Soul of Light (Ki, Attack) - +2 Damage. If this attack destroys an enemy Unit, Macbeth cannot lose Life Points for the rest of the Turn.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Drake
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Vagabond, mercenary, savior, and exterminator ... these are but a few of the titles Drake has received. One of the last inheritors of the Blood of the Dragon, he is cursed by a power that he can't yet control. He travels the world trying to find his destiny ... before it finds him.

Warrior - Neutral Wanderer - Level 50

Dragon Wing (Ki, Charge) - +3 Attack / +2 Damage. If Dragon Wing is being used to Charge an enemy Unit that is within 8 inches of Drake, then he has Flight during this Charge.

Dragon Overdrive (Ki, Attack) - +3 Attack / +3 Damage.

Seals of the Dragon (Ki, Effect) - Drake gets +2 Attack and +2 Defense.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Grey Rhodes
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Grey Rhodes is a living shield. Protecting innocent lives is all that matters to him. A former agent of the Inquisition, legendary for his cold-blooded ruthlessness, he left that position to join the Knights of the Holy Order. Now, in penance for the lives he snuffed out, he has vowed to protect the innocent multitudes.

Warrior - Light Church - Level 40

Exaltation: If at least one friendly Unit within Grey's Control Zone is below half of their starting Life Points, he gets +1 Attack and +1 Defense.

Guardian:Grey can Intercept a Charge or Ranged Attack from up to 4 inches away.

The Promise:Grey cannot destroy enemy Units. If any of his Attacks would reduce an enemy Unit to having less than 1 LP, it is left with 1 LP instead.

Final Protection (Ki, Effect, Reactive) - Activate this ability at the end of the Maintenance phase. For the rest of the Turn Grey can Dodge for free.

Lightning Retribution (Ki, Attack, Reactive) - Attack +5. This Attack can only be used when an enemy Unit engaged with Grey makes an Attack against a friendly Unit other than Grey. This Attack is made after the enemy Unit rolls for its own attack.

My life for Thine (Subterfuge, Effect, Reactive) - When a friendly Unit within Grey's Control Zone is reduced to 0 or less Life Points, you may remove Grey from the game as a casualty to return the friendly unit to 1 life point.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Luzbell
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

After Luzbell's magical abilities manifested at an early age she was sent to the church to train and focus her abilities in the proper way. She has progressed rapidly not only showing an aptitude for innovative applications of light magic but also devouring alchemical teachings at a pace her instructors find somewhat intimidating. Luzbell may be young, but she is a rising star in the Church's firmament.

Mystic - Light Church - Level 40

Holy Reflection (Magic, Dodge) - It can only be used against Ranged Attacks. If Luzbell dodges successfully, the attack is redirected to any enemy unit that would be within the distance of the attack if it where performed by Luzbell. This attack keeps all of the attributes of the original attacker, but Luzbell must make a new attack roll.

Holy Cut (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance 16 inches. Damage +2.
Limit: Once per Turn.

Divine Shield (Magic, Dodge) - May be used after the roll for the attack.

Mirror Jump (Magic, Effect) - Relocate a friendly unit within Luzbell’s control zone to any other position within her control zone even if the unit is engaged in combat, or into base-to-base contact.
Limit: Once per Turn.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Hiro
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Hiro was a slight boy who always dreamed of becoming a "Hero of Justice" whose wish has amazingly become a reality. After suffering a crippling and horrific accident, Wissenschaft researchers subjected Hiro’s body to a ridiculously large dose of Process. Hiro was reborn with abilities to match his wildest dreams. Now, convinced that he is part of a secret society that seeks to protect the world while operating from the shadows, he has no qualms about using his superhuman prowess to further the aims of Wissenschaft. Along with the other crows, the "Ranger Avengers" as he calls them, Hiro stands ready to safeguard Gaia, at least in his own mind.

Warrior - Light Wissenschaft - Level 50

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Arias Vayu
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Queen of the Winds, Lady of the Sylph, Stormbringer... many are the names that the Arias Vayu, the higher class of air elemental, are known by. Like lesser demigods, these creatures only walk Gaïa when called by the most powerful of summoners. Able to control the weather over the whole world there powers are fearsome indeed.

Mystic - Light Summon - Level 50

Innate Abilities: Flight, Intangible, Ranged Attack 16 inches.
Blades of Air: Arias Vayu's Attacks ignore 1 point of their target's Armor.

Elemental Crystals: Arias Vayu is accompanied by four elemental crystals that must be placed in contact with her base when she is summoned to the board. The crystals move independently during Arias Vayu's activation as flying units with Speed of 12 inches and a Control Zone of 4 inches. The crystals cannot take any other action than to move and are immune to negative states. They may be the target of any attack, in which case they have a Defense of 8 and 1 LP. They can be engaged in Hand-to-hand combat, though any unit that wants to withdraw from combat with them can do so without needing to Escape first. A crystal is destroyed if it suffers any damage, and they all will be removed when Aria's Vayu leaves the game for any reason.

Elemental Crystal (Magic, Effect) - Put an Elemental Crystal on the board within Arias Vayu's Control Zone. This ability only allows the replacement of already destroyed crystals. It cannot allow Arias Vayu to have more than 4 crystals on the board at once.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Erika
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Impetuous and spirited, Erika is the youngest member of the Hand of the Empress. She wields one of the legendary weapons of the Sidhe. Though she is only 13 years old, her destructive power is on par with some of the best fighters in the world.

Warrior - Light Empire - Level 40

Innate Ability:
Mjolnir: Whenever Erika causes a critical hit, the defender loses an action point and the attack causes Throw.

Ka-Boom! (Ki, Effect) - Every enemy unit within Erika's Control Zone loses 1 Action point. Effect 15.

Spin! Spin! Spin! (Ki, Attack) - While making this attack Erika rolls two dice and keeps the highest. This attack effects every enemy unit within two inches of her. After the attack roll is resolved Erika suffers Slow Lv. 1

Taunt (Subterfuge, Effect) - The closest unengaged enemy unit within Erika's Control Zone suffers Berserk Lv 1, Effect 15. Limit: Once per game.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Cennette
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Despite being the third Princess Daphne, Cennette chose to leave Rose Island to its fate and pursue the man she loves, Drake. Blessed with angelic blood and a stunning natural aptitude for combat, Cennette is renowned as one of the most skilled fighters of her time. At Drake’s side she doesn’t hesitate to take arms when necessary.

Warrior - Light Wanderer - Level 45

Master Dodge: Whenever Cenette Dodges successfully, you may move her 2 inches. This movement may be used to leave Hand-to-hand combat without having used an Action to Escape previously.

Supreme Agility: When Cenette Charges (Normal or Special) she can change the direction of her Line of Charge one time. The Charge can still be Intercepted if she passes close enough to an enemy Unit.

Albas (Ki, Charge) - +3 Attack / +2 Damage.

Last Rose (Ki, Attack) - +5 Attack.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Snorks Adventure Board Game
Description: From the back of the box "Be the first player to collect five different Snorks cards and return safely to Snorkville High School." Based on the semi-popular Snorks cartoon series from the mid 80s. Spin the spinner and move both your pawn and the shark on different tracks around the board.

Name: Chuggington: Die Loks sind los!
Description:
The game board contains a track on which a battery-powered engine named Wilson moves toward the railway station. The players join the race with their engine pawns. These are moved by dice rolls. A color as a roll result means the pawn can move forward to the nearest space in the rolled color; a green light means it can move ahead of the leading engine, a red light means that Wilson is moved backwards to the last red stop light.

The first engine to reach the station is the winner (that could be Wilson, too).

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Golf Arama
Description:
From theirs within the RULES printed upon this box-top:

The object of the game is to reach each green and hole out in least number of strokes as in the game of golf.  There are five stacks of cards, each with different yardage denominations. Play proceeds by following instructions as you draw each card. Drawing a card is the same as taking a stroke in golf. The three dice are used to determine putts required to hole out. Score is kept as in regular golf.

Their components as with a FOUR players game comprise:

Wooden golf tees in 5 colors

3 *Special* dice with either 2, 4, or 6 single 'pips' arranged upon them.

3 Decks-worth of varied amounts for YARDAGE RANGE and/or HAZARD encounter on this.

1 small white plastic Dice Cup
1 Score Pencil & small Score Sheet with "Golf Arama" upon theirs, and: SEEN at any local Golf Course.

1 Game-board of "Monopoly"-sort for manufacture in bi-fold overall dimension, with 9-Holes depicted as hand-drawn artworks and arranged with even varying array for some of it'sa "TRAPS".

Name: Illuminati: Unconstitutional! Promo Card
Description:
This is a give away card distributed at conventions or by buying from Warehouse 23 (SJ Games' online store).

By playing this card you can cancel an NWO just played and, if you also control the Supreme Court, you can replace the cancelled NWO with any NWO of the same colour, or choose not to replace it at all.

Name: Line Up
Description:
An abstract game for 2-6 players. Contents: 90 cards showing one or more lines and curves in different colours.

Gameplay: The goal of the game is to have the fewest cards (ideally, none) at the end of the game. Each player receives 8 cards, the rest forms the draw pile. One card is then flipped over from the draw pile, and the start player tries to place one of her cards so that the colours line up with this card. Play then proceeds with the next player trying to line up one of his cards with one of the face-up cards. If a player cannot line up any of his cards, he draws cards until he can; if the draw pile has run out, he misses his turn instead. The game ends if one player manages to get rid of all her cards, in which case she wins, or, if no more cards can be placed, in which case the player with the fewest cards left wins.

Name: Which Hello Kitty Are You
Description:
Are you more like the Hello Kitty that loves the outdoors or the one that wants to be inside playing guitar? Start by playing the fast paced card game where numbers quickly go up and down. The first player to win four rounds gets to answer personality cards and find out which Hello Kitty they are most like.

Contents: 

     Hello Kitty 88 card deck, 
     49 Hello Kitty question cards, 
     14 plastic tokens, 
     rules, 
     personality guide booklet.

Name: Epic Tower Defense
Description: In Epic Tower Defense, each player is charged with defending a secluded research facility from an ever-increasing horde of alien invaders called the Tyravyn.  Players will use their resources to strategically build defensive towers along the Tyravyn's invasion path.  As invaders are destroyed, players earn additional resources to build new towers with.  The player who does the best job surviving the Tyravyn raid wins!

Name: Mercenary Commander (fan expansion for Risk 2210 A.D.)
Description:
From the publisher's site:

Trickery and cunning are the main characteristics of this Commander. He always attacks with an 8-sided dice and can acquire new much needed MODs for your army. That is why he can be an excellent aid to your cause.

The card deck that becomes available to you after hiring this Commander consists of the following 20 cards:

Colony Influence x 4
Colony Influence x 3
Defensive Measures x 2
Dirty Death Trap x 2
Last Stand x3
Minefield x 2
Paratroopers x 1
Changing Allegiance x 3

The Mercenary Commander is great and cheap way for gathering new MODs for offense and defense. Also he has a few special tricks that can completely catch the opponent off his guard. He is best used in combination with the Diplomat and Nuclear Commadners.

This Command Deck makes a great addition to Risk 2210 A.D. and provides more hours of fun.

Name: Rapid Fire!
Description:
Fast Play WW2 rules at battalion level for 20mm model soldiers and tanks.
Units are represented by model figures. It uses a combination of D6 and D10 to determine the effects of fire and moral. The system uses a ruler to determine movement (decided by the type of suspension used by Vehicles, 9 inches for infantry maximum), which can be affected, by terrain. Infantry and AT fire use slightly different systems (and dice, infantry fore is resolved using the d6 whilst AT fire uses the d10). Indirect fire uses a template to determine where shells land and uses to infantry fire chart to determine effect.

In the game players command units from the various armies forces of WW2. The basic rules come with a few organisation charts (Africa Korps Infantry Battalion, British 25 Pdr Battery,  British Guards Motor rifle battalion, German tank company, German Recce Battalion and Luftwaffe Field battalion) it also included scenarios covering the whole war in Europe and Africa. It also included a Hong Kong campaign.

Name: Rapid Fire!: Korean War Supplement
Description: A supplement giving organisations and game statistics for the formations and equipment used by the Communist and UN forces during the Korean War. You need a copy of Rapid Fire! first edition to play.

Name: Planet kort
Description:
This is a danish card game about our solar system. The game has 42 card. One card represent the Sun. The other cards represent planets (including the earth), moons, asteroids and comets. Each card have information about the object it represents and a picture of the object.

The game can be played in three different ways; One called Build Solar System, one called War of the Worlds and one rummy-styled game.

In Build Solar System the first player to get rid of all your cards first win. Each player start with three card. The first player draws a card and play a card. Then each player in turn add a card to the Solar System by playing cards next to card on the table. Planet cards must be played next to planets they are next to in order from the Sun. Moons must be placed perpendicular to the planet they circle. Asteroids are placed in a asteroid field between Mars and Jupiter. Coments act as jokers and can be placed anywhere insted of another card. If you can't add a card to the Solar System you must draw a card insted.

In War of the Worlds each player has a deck of card and you try to get the most cards. The starting player look at the top card and pick one piece of information on the card: mass, diameter, density, speed, length of the day, temperature or distance to the sun. All players now show their top card. The one with the higher value get all the cards and put the card on the bottom of the deck. That player now look at the top card and pick a piece of information on that card. When one player has no card in the deck the game ends and the player with the most cards win.

In the rummy-styled game each player tries to get the most points by playing sets of cards. Each card has a point value printed in the rigth corner. Each player start with 6 cards in the hand. The rest of the card is placed in to deck and the top card is turned over - this is the start of the dicard pile. The players now takes turns. In a turn you start by drawing a card. Then you have the option to play a set of tree. A set must be either three planets next to eash other in the ord they placed from the sun, three moons from the same planet, a planet and two of its moons or thee asteroids. You end you turn by discarding a card. When one player has no cards in the hand game ends. The player with to highest total point value on the table win.

Name: Spectra PR-1200
Description:
A trivial-like game with an sci-fi touch. Each player start on the earth, and must travel thru space answering general knowledge questions, until they reach a planet, where they must answer questions about specific matters. If they answer correctly, they get their visa and can continue travelling until the next planet, and so. The first to reach planet Spectra wins.

Like other Cefa games, there are two editions of the game: The cheap one, wich comes in a small, square box, and the more expensive one, which comes in a rectangular box. This one offers a better gameboard and includes an small black robot figure that didn't come with the other edition.

Name: ¡Que cara tienes!
Description: A game of logic and deduction, similar to Guess Who?. Each player pick a card with a character on it. The objetive of the game is guessing the other player's character before he guesses your own. The mechanic consist in asking questions about the character's appearance, progressively discarding the others until the right one it's revealed

Name: The Game of Zoo-Zoo
Description:
36 cards in 3 suits of twelve, plus 4 special cards - The Bad Boy, The Old Witch, The Wicked Cat and Zoo-Zoo himself (a dressed-up monkey). Each suit has 8 identical cards and 4 special cards - King, Queen, Jumbo and Neddy.
Players must guess the colour of the top card on the face down deck. If correct, he keeps the card and draws two more cards which are kept secret. If he is wrong about the colour, he hands the card to the player on his right, who keeps it.
The Zoo-Zoo card is wild and is all three colours, so a player keeps it no matter which colour he predicted (but he does not draw the bonus 2 cards).
The Old Witch, The Wicked Cat, and The Bad Boy are of no colour and the player drawing one of them will always be wrong with the colour he predicted.In addition he must lose 4, 3, or 2 cards respectively from his collection.
The game ends when the last card is picked up. Zoo-Zoo counts 7 points, any King 5 points, any Queen 4 points, any Elephant 3 points, and any Donkey scores 2 points. All Balloon cards score 1 point each. Finally, the colourless cards score -4 for the Witch, -3 for the Cat and -2 for the Boy. The game is played until one player has scored 100 points.

Name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Die Begleiter
Description:
What would Holmes be without Watson, Achill without Patroklos or Batman without Robin?

This mini-expansion introduces four different companions that help the heroes with their unique abilities.

Golem - carries one item for you
Leprechaun - has a pot of gold
Shoulder dragon - burns your enemies
Talking sword - mocks your enemies in combat

All companions can be used and gained instead of a skill card, and whenever you have to discard a skill card, you may decide to discard a companion instead. Also, the higher your charisma is, the more companions would be willing to travel with you.

Source: translation from publishers website and own additions.

Name: For King or Parliament?
Description:
Strategic Campaign of The English Civil Wars. Includes Historical and Hypothetical scenarios.

Game designed to be playable and fun and concentrates on the strategic elements of the war. Some tactical elements do come into play with differences between Pike, Musketeers, Dragoons,Forts, and Navies. Another aspect to the game is the Scottish dimension and trying to keep Scotland in the war.

Included with the game are secret order cards, either General Direction cards, or, Orders to the Armies.Once played, players are committed to a certain move or order thereby adding to the Fog of War.

The game comes in `Kit` form which means some preparation is required.(Cutting counters and adding 10 sided dice ).All counters are Regiments of Pike,Musket,Horse, etc
Players recruit armies from either an historical or free set up.Army Commanders are then deployed to units (5 per Royalist and Parliament).Orders are then issued secretly to armies stacked only with Commanders from a pool of movement tokens ( i.e North, South, West, East, South East, North West, etc).
Movement is up to 3 areas for Foot, 4 for Horse, and 1 for Guns. Players then roll a die to reveal who has the turn initiative and players then reveal their orders and move units checking for possible contacts with the enemy.  If contact is made with the enemy, tactic cards come into play, each side either playing, Search,Hold, or Evade and rolling a 10 sided die for the outcome, which may still lead to armies not engaging in battle. If battles do occur, then they are resolved using  10 sided dice and cross checking a percentage number for units engaged (Pike,Musket,Dragoons,Horse,Guns,Siege,Ships) on a Fire and Melee table. An example of Pike on Melee is 60%, so if 3 Pike regiments were involved in a battle on either side, 3 10 sided dice would be rolled and would hit on a roll of 1-6.
These rolls can be adjusted by terrain the defender holds, and the Commanders used, who gain battle experience the further the game goes on. Most Commanders start at experience level
0 or 1.Both The King and Cromwell start at 0 experience.
The game is played in weekly turns and starts from Jan 1642 and lasts till September 1650 (a possible 36 turns ).Players may also recruit further armies during recruiting phases in
1643, 1646, and 1649.

Name: Who's Missing?
Description:
In Who’s Missing: A Calico Critters Card Game, two to four players try to memorize an ever-increasing number of cards and remember the missing cards after some are removed by the dealer. The 48 cards feature pictures of the Calico Critters families and can be used to play two additional games.

Deal out 5 cards in a row. Players hide their eyes while the dealer takes away a card. Who can remember which critters are missing? As the game is played the row of cards grows, so the longer you play the more challenging! Cards are also fun collector cards for Calico Critter fans.

Name: You Gotta Be Kidding Card Game
Description:
Card game version of the board game with same name. You Gotta Be Kidding gets kids and grown-ups thinking, laughing, reasoning and having a blast making goofy decisions and completing the wild "Would You Rather" Challenges. Best of all, kids have fun speaking up for a change, instead of always saying "I don't know." Watch imagination rule and confidence build as kids get comfortable standing up for their choice while laughing the whole time. Players must choose between two difficult scenarios such as: eating a bucket of apple stems or eating 20 banana stems. "Neither" is not permitted as an answer in this card game.

Contents:

     160 "Would You Rather" Questions
     2 Choice Chips

Name: Orðaspilið: stafaspil
Description: From the rules: A deck of 72 cards plus 3 scoring cards and 1 title card. Each card has a letter printed on it (each letter of the alphabet on two cards). The game plays similar to rummy; draw a card from the deck or discarded cards, lay down cards to form a word and discard one card. Each round finishes when the first player plays his last card and then the scores are added up. Game ends when someone has 1000 points (or 100 in the children's variant).

Name: Berserk
Description:
The clock is ticking and your time is running out.  You need to find just the right peg!  Can you do it before you go Berserk?   This classic beat-the-clock game combines fun, luck and even a little strategy.  Start the clock.  Then try to get all the numbers in order from 1 to 20.

Game offers three different skill levels: color matching, color sequencing and counting from 1-20.

Contents: 

     Game base with integrated timer, 
     20 Pegs

Name: Auf und Davon
Description:
from espenlaub.de

"It dawns the morning and the time to dive into the grave. And then the race starts. Head Over Heels is rolled to the right signposts. And then, on the way, they must be extremely careful to not fall into the evil Garlic fog. Which vampire trio go first to the tomb?"

Logic game in which players goes theirs vampires to the crypts.

Player thrown cube and moves his vampire on first free symbol (vertical or horizontal). When a garlic appears, player moves "garlic-clouds" which are blocking opponent move.

Name: Down in Flames: Aces High – Extra Decks
Description:
The card decks contained in the Down In Flames - Aces High game will accommodate up to 6 players. However, if you want to play monster air battles, this is the item for you!

This is functionally an expansion as it ups the number of players in the game from six to twelve.

Name: Hot Dog Run
Description:
Available as the toy prize in a children's meal at A&W Restaurants, Hot Dog Run is a simple matching game for 2 to 3 players.

Each player begins with a set number of hot dogs (7 each for a 2-player game; 5 each for 3-player), and then starting with the youngest player (who places their first hot dog near the "start" space on the package) they alternate placing one hot dog at a time so that the symbol on one end matches the symbol on the end of the previously played hot dog.   If a player cannot make a match, they must take a new hot dog from the draw pile and then may play it if it matches (if no match is found, that player's turn ends).

The first player to run out of hot dogs wins.

Name: Fungus
Description:
Fungus is an abstract strategy game played on a hex grid by 2 to 4 players. Players take turns placing markers into hex spaces with the ultimate goal of having the fewest number of connected areas on the board and the most markers on the board when the board is completely full.

At the beginning of the game, players take three turns placing a marker anywhere on the board, except along an edge or adjacent to any other marker. After this initial phase, player take turns placing markers, but now they must be adjacent to an enemy marker. During the game, players may have the opportunity to capture enemy markers and place one of their markers in the space or save the markers to alter scores at the end of the game. When the entire board is full of markers, players count their total number of markers on the board and deduct their total number of separate disconnected groups from that amount. The player with the highest total wins.

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Mask of the Archmaester
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

Mask of the Archmaester, the fifth monthly Chapter Pack in the Secrets of Oldtown cycle of expansions for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, introduces 60 cards - three copies each of 20 never-before-seen locations, attachments, characters, events, and plots to aid your A Game of Thrones deckbuilding goals. This Chapter Pack features more Chain attachments as well as more diverse and surprising events and support for the ever-deepening Maester trait.

New characters from George R.R. Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire are introduced into the Living Card Game environment for the first time, including Ser Jon Fossoway and The Mad Mouse. Exciting new versions of existing characters will also enter the fold, including a Rickon Stark that will aid House Stark's deck-searching capabilities. Watch out as sub-themes expand further, including House Dayne's Starfall Cavalry, Iron Fleet Raiders, and more!
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Sooty in Wonderland
Description:
This is a roll and move game except that you don't roll dice. Instead, the roads on the board have brown lines at intervals and when you move you can only cross one brown line. These lines are diffent distances apart so one turn you may have a decent move, the next a poor one.
The object is to collect 4 special cards - Password Sesame, the Magic Wand, some Oofle Dust and the Key to the Chest. Three Treasure cards are turned face up. When you reach a star symbol on the board that matches one of the three face up cards, you may take one of these cards, then the display is refreshed.
There are Who Knows cards as well which act as Chance cards.
If you collect the four special cards, you must make your way to Sooty's Cave and claim the treasure in the Chest there.
It is suggested that you play a number of games and record the scores to decide a winner.

Name: Jack of all Trades
Description:
The game is played with a pack of 52 cards, made up of 12 tradesmen and a Burglar each using three tools. Players are dealt hands of four cards, and each turn must draw from the top of the deck or from the discard pile. After each draw, the player must discard a card face down. The first player to collect a set of a tradesman and his three tools wins the hand.

The adult version of the game is set up for gambling. Each person antes a coin at the start of each hand. The winner of the hand collects half the pot, but if he has included another tradesman's tool by mistake, he loses a like amount instead. If any player has the Burglar in hand, he must pay a penalty of half the pot - unless he also has the Bobby, in which case he takes the other half of the pot. Similarly, anyone holding one of the Burglar's tools (crowbar, mask or swag bag) pays a penalty of two coins each unless also holding one of the Bobby's tools (handcuffs, lantern or helmet).

There are also rules for young people that make the game a form of "Go Fish".

Name: Wordex
Description:
52 cards. "The New Card Game of Skill", so says the box.
Each card has a letter. There are more cards for some letters than others. No rules I'm afraid but probably a crossword type game, made to compete with Lexicon, which was a big seller for Waddingtons at that time.

Name: Pok-A-Dice
Description:
A great party game of chance. Everybody wins--not always, but sometimes! Friendly fun to liven up a party.

Players bet their chips on the Pok-e-dice layout: one each on "Low Hand", "High Hand", "Low Total", "High Total", "Pot".

Players roll the dice and selects the poker combinations. place their chips on the layout and after everybody has taken their turn, the player with the highest score wins all the chips in the "Pot"

Name: Rapid Fire!: Pusan to Panmunjom
Description: A comprehensive guide to the Korean war produced to accompany the Rapid Fire rules. Included Rapid Fire lists for all the combatants in the Korean War and game stats for Point of Attack. Also includes its own war game called Take the High Ground, A solo game in which the player commands a US Infantry (Army or Marine) Platoon using 2d6 to determine the result of GUTS (a two digit number representing the unit's skill) tests.

Name: Skee Ball
Description:
An action game for 1 or more players.
Let the ball to roll out of the slot and into the shooter. Then aim and pull back and shooter and release it. The ball will shoot up to the target area at the top of the game enter one of the holes and roll down into the proper scoring column.The positions of the balls in these columns indicates the score.
Repeat until all balls are played. 
When the turns are completed add the first number showing above the balls in each column beginning at the left and adding all six of the columns.

Name: Walibi The Battle Game
Description:
A CCG of Walibi released for the super market company Carrefour in Belgium. Each package includes 3 cards with the entire collection existing out of 101 cards.

The rules for the game are simple: Every player takes at least 3 cards face down. Now the first player takes the first card from his deck and chooses one of the four characteristics (courage, creativity, coolness, musicality) which all have a specific score. After choosing the category all players turn the card and place it on the gameboard so that everybody can see it. Now the players compare the score of the chosen characteristic. The player with the highest score on that characteristic wins the round. If there's a tie, then the cards remain on the board till the next round. The winner of the next round also gets those cards. The game goes on until one person has won all the cards in the game.

For collecting purposes people have made their own interpretation of the game or let the winner choose a card from one of the losers decks.

Name: Duel Masters
Description:
Duel Masters is an abstract two-player game in which each player (starting at opposite ends of the map) must reach the opponent's starting position by building a chain of game pieces.

The game is played on a square grid rotated 45°. The pieces are played on intersections, like Go. Each player puts 3 of her pieces in her starting position, then players take turn playing three pieces at a time. Pieces can be played anywhere as long as they are connected to another of the player's pieces. The opponent's pieces can be taken by playing another piece on top of them, which can sever the opponent's chain. Once a piece is taken, the space it's in can't be taken again, it remains in control of the player who took the piece.

Once an uninterrupted chain is built between the two starting positions, the player who built the chain is declared winner.

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Shifting Sands Asylum Pack
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Shifting Sands is the first Asylum Pack in the Ancient Relics cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. The Great Old Ones' reach extends worldwide in this debut pack, which alone in this cycle features 12 new story cards. The Shifting Sands strikes out in a bold new direction, moving Call of Cthulhu's action away from the darkened mansions of Arkham and onto the burning sands of Egypt. Learn what evil lurks in the cursed tomb beneath the pyramids!

Investigators and Cultists confront each other - and sometimes work together - beneath the shadows of the great pyramids, in The Shifting Sands. In this Asylum Pack you will meet diverse agents from each of Call of Cthulhu's factions. The Shifting Sands also features a number of new Relic support cards: ancient and powerful tools that will aid your faction's takeover of the world for the Ancient Ones or guard against them.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Celebritease
Description:
The new outrageous fast-paced game of celebrity icons.

To play Celebritease, all you need is a knack for celebrities of all kinds, a vivid imagination, a keen memory, reckless abandon, or a couple good shots.

The object is simple: earn the most points. Fun ensues when you get just :60 to get teammates to name as many celebrities as possible. Sing, dance, draw, act, cough - whatever.

Sound easy? Sure. That's assuming you know the name of, say, Buster Keaton's pet dog. Otherwise, you'll be pulling your hair out trying to get others to say "Luke".

Name: Cywilizacja: Poprzez wieki – Polski dodatek 1
Description:
Expansion consisting of six additional cards added to Polish edition of the game.


     "Kopalnia Soli w Wieliczce", Age I wonder, "One of your level A or I mine produces twice as many (resources). One of your level A or I farm produces twice as many (food)."
     "PaÅ‚ac Kultury i Nauki", Age III wonder, "You immediately score culture according to your culture rating and 1/4/9/16 culture for 1/2/3/4 different special (blue) technology cards you have in play."
     "MikoÅ‚aj Kopernik", Age I leader, "Your best temple or library produces an additional amount of science equal to its level. Every time you play a special (blue) technology card, you get 1 (science) and 1 (resource)."
     "Jan PaweÅ‚ II", Age III leader, "Each of your temples (temple) produces an amount of (culture) equal to its level. Your government produces an amount of (culture) equal to its level."
     "Rozbiory", Age II aggression, 3 military actions, "Take that many yellow tokens as level of your government and that many blue tokens as level of your rival's government from rival's banks."
     "Husaria", Age II tactics, 2x (cavalry), 1x (artillery) = +7 strength (this card is used at Boardgaming online in Extended 2.0 variant)

Name: Cywilizacja: Poprzez wieki – Polski dodatek 2
Description:
Expansion consisting of four additional cards added to second Polish edition of the game.


     "Mieszko I", Age A leader, "You gain 2 military actions. You may draw up to 4 military cards at the end of turn.",
     "Fryderyk Chopin", Age II leader, "This leader gives you 2 extra happy faces. When Chopin leaves game chose opponent and gain culture equal to culture rating of that opponent.",
     "Biskupin", Age A wonder, "Strength bonus doesn't count while you are playing an aggression."
     "Belweder", Age II wonder, "Once per turn you may play action card you have taken that turn.".

Name: Total Out
Description:
Total Out: The fun and action game for two to six players.
Total Out calls for quick thinking and a bit of luck. Just give the floating dial a spin. It´s fun! It´s easy! When the arrow stops, take a number disc from that pit and place it on any square on your Playcard. The first player to place five discs in a row - up and down or across - which add up to the total shown at the end of that row yells, "Total Out" and wins!

Contents:

     Total Out contains number discs, 
     playcards, 
    Total Out tray with floating dial

Name: Egghead or Chicken: Set II
Description: New set of 88 Cards (red on white) for the 3M's Egghead or Chicken featuring new questions on a variety of subjects. Equal number of basic and advanced Cards.

Name: Egghead or Chicken: Set III
Description: New set of 88 Cards (green on white) for the 3M's Egghead or Chicken featuring more advanced questions and subject matter. Contains a larger number of advanced Cards.

Name: Gute Nacht
Description:
A beautiful game dealing with a good night theme for kids 2 and up.
Roll the die, take a star from the bed matching the same color and the one with the most star win the game.

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hills of Emyn Muil
Description:
Game description from the publisher:
 Having lost Gollum's trail at the Carrock, then embarked on a mission of mercy to Rhosgobel, the heroes now come to the hills of Emyn Muil, where they have only one objective: to find Gollum.

The Hills of Emyn Muil is the fourth Adventure Pack in the Shadows of Mirkwood cycle of expansions for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game! The hunt for Gollum continues in this exciting expansion, which includes a Quest card and its related Encounters, as well as new Hero, Attachment, and Ally cards. This engaging Adventure Pack contains the first ever single-card quest, in which players must gather victory points by exploring a wide range of dangerous locations.

With 60 new cards for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game, The Hills of Emyn Muil will augment existing decks while providing players with entirely new challenges for their heroes. Can you scour Emyn Muil and determine Gollum's whereabouts before it's too late?
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Snack Attack!
Description: In this fast-paced, picture matching, token-stacking game, players race to identify and collect the most food items to place on their snack plates.  During the game, one player acts as the "chef" and rotates the spinner around the platter dispensing seven food items.  All players then compete to call out items matching those on their individual snack plates, flipping the tokens that are won to reveal new snacks to match.  At the end of the game, the player with the most snacks on their plate wins!

Name: Hold On Scooby-Doo
Description:
Scooby and Shaggy sit on top of a wall of bricks. On your turn, use one of the ghost hands to push out a brick...very, very carefully! On someone's turn they will tumble down. Yipes! Don't let it be YOU!
If you knock down the heroes, you lose.

Contents: 

     Wall frame, 44 bricks, 
     Scooby-Doo / Shaggy figure, 
     2 ghost hands

Name: Excellence: Cartes Supplementaires
Description: Expansion for the Game of Knowledge by Milton Bradley French Edition. Additional 1000 questions/answers for the base game.

Name: Cupeed
Description:
In Cupeed, players want to be the first to build a 3x3x3 cube – dubbed a 333 cube by the publisher – from the parts available to them.

At the start of a round, the 27 wooden blocks – with each block being composed of 3-5 connected cubes – are laid on the game board. These blocks come in four colors, and all the blocks of a single color can be assembled into a 333 cube, although some are more difficult to construct than others. Each player receives a hand of five cards from the deck of 55 cards. Cards come in two types:

• Block card – which shows a color and a number from 3 to 5. By playing this card, you choose a block that matches the specifications on the card and add it to your collection of blocks.

• Function card – which allows you to take a special action on your turn: taking an opponent's block or forcing a swap with an opponent, choosing a block of your choice, forcing all players to return a block, and cancelling one of the aforementioned special actions.

At the start of the game, all players reveal the block cards in their hands, and the player with the lowest sum of numbers chooses blocks first, then the next player, and so on. Thus, each player will start with a different collection of blocks and possibly a different number of cards in hand. On a turn, a player first draws a card. If he has two or fewer cards in hand, he can play one card or end his turn. If he has 3-5 cards, he must either play a card, discard a card, or discard a block from his collection. If he has six cards, he must play a card.

The first player to assemble a 333 cube with no extra blocks and no protrustions or holes in the structure wins the round. The first player to win two rounds wins the game. If you assemble a 333 cube from nine blocks or in a single color, then you win the game instantly.

Name: Quarter Bouncers
Description:
Originally designed to be the ultimate "Quarters" game played on a basketball court, Quarter Bouncers requires some coin-bouncing skills and is especially challenging to teens and adults who are are competitive and enjoy party games.  Now, it's also the ultimate "Hoops" game for kids of all ages and is played with a miniature basketball. It comes with mini basketballs to practice bouncing and then you use your own coin to bounce.
Who shoots better is the winner.

Name: Anima Tactics: Azriel
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

The name of the Inquisitor Azriel has become legend among the ranks of the 13th Cardinal’s agents. Gifted with skills only equal to his malice toward anyone who defies the Abel’s Church, this dark hunter travels thoughout Gaïa killing his master’s enemies without regret or pity.

Warrior - Dark Church - Level 50

Invite Hell (Ki, Attack) - +5 Attack.

Promised Pain (Ki, Attack, Reactive) - +5 Attack. Promised Pain can be used only in the moment that Azriel sustains damage from an enemy unit and must target the same character that had attacked him.

Wings of Sin (Ki, Attack) - +6 Attack. If Wings of Sin causes damage, target unit suffers Lv2 Doom, Effect 15. To use this attack, Azriel must have 6 or fewer Life points.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Kairos
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

The duk/zarist Kairos is the younger brother of the 9 Fallen Angel, Ophiel, one of the lords of Samael. Even though he opposes his brothers radical view of humankind, he works under his command hoping that in this way he can mitigate his brother’s most extreme actions.

Warrior - Dark Samael - Level 45

Dark Valestis (Ki, Charge) - +4 Damage. Kairos may charge up to 16 inches.

Soul Spiral (Ki, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 inches). +2 Damage.

Final Burst (Ki, Attack) - Final Burst affects all enemy units within 3 inches of Kairos. Kairos may spend an additional action point to gain +2 Attack.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Jerome
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Jerome, the second member of the Three People in the Abyss. In devotion to his sister, Jerome gave up his position as the heir of his clan to follow Hel into exile. Like their leader Dead Moon, he is working with the Azur Alliance under the orders of the High Arbiter Aizen. As a born warrior, Jerome has inherited the ancient combat skills of his family and has combined them with the pirate queen personal style, which makes him a particularly deadly foe.

Warrior/Prowler - Dark Azur Alliance - Level 40

Innate Abilities: Infiltration

Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect) - Jerome becomes Hidden. Upkeep: 1

Mark of Death (Subterfuge, Attack) - +3 Attack / +3 Damage. This skill can be used only if Jerome is Hidden.

Maw of the Leviathan (Subterfuge, Effect) - Target unit inside Jerome's Control Zone loses 1 action point and may not move this turn. Effect 15.
Limit: 1 per turn.

Hell Wave (Ki, Attack) - -1 Attack. Hell Wave affects all enemy units within 2 inches.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Justina
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Born with the terrible ability to see the sins hidden in the souls of others, Justian nearly went mad as a child. After being sent to the holy city of Albidion to be trained as a church executioner, she fell into the most absolute desperation, from which she was only able to escape thanks to the love and dedication of Damien, who trained alongside her. Now she is a solitary and terrifyingly efficient Inquisitor, able not only to wield an inhuman martial ability, but also to control the evil inside others and cause it to devour them from within. She finds dark pleasure in the hunt, and nothing makes her feel alive like vanquishing those with interior darkness.

Unfortunately, in her damned eyes, very few are innocent.

Warrior - Dark Church - Level 45

Nux: If Justina suffers damage from a Magical ability she recovers an Action Point.
Anathema: All of Justina's attacks against Mystic units use her secondary Damage attribute.

Tears of Heaven (Ki, Attack) - +2 Damage. Roll two dice and keep the highest result.

Sinner's Glare (Ki, Effect) - Cast Blind Lv. 2 on an enemy unit within Justina's Control Zone. Effect 14.

Suppression Aura (Magic, Effect) - Any enemy units that use a Magic ability in Justina's Control Zone automatically lose 3 LP. Upkeep: o

Penitent Shot (Ki, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 Inches), +1 Attack, +2 Damage. If Penitent Shot causes any damage, the affected unit suffers Seal Lv. 2, Effect 15. Justina cannot Walk or Run in the turn she uses this attack.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Anima Tactics: Bael
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bael is one of the half bred daughters of the demon queen Tiamat. After living hidden among humans for centuries, she now works under the Fallen Angel Ophiel as his personal agent.

Mystic - Dark Samael - Level 45

Dark Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance Attack (16 inches). +1 Attack/ +2 Damage

The Mark of Erebus (Magic, Effect) - Cast Lvl 2 Seal on an enemy unit inside Bael's Control Zone. Effect 16.

The Mark of Noah (Magic,Effect) - Cast lvl 2 Berserk on an enemy or friendly unit inside Bael's Control Zone. Effect 16.

The Mark of Jedah (Magic, Effect) - Cast Lvl 2 Paralyze on an enemy unit inside Bael's Control Zone. Effect 16.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Schmuck und Handel (fan expansion for Stone Age)
Description:
"Schmuck und Handel" is an fan expansion for Stone Age. The unofficial expansion adds some new gameplay elements.

New Huts
New Cilivisationcards
Additional Gameboard
5th and 6th Player
Market
Jewellery
Jewellery-pieces
...

At the moment, rules are available in german only.

Have fun.

Name: Coodju Lite
Description:
Coodju Lite is an elegant adaptation of Coodju, reduced in complexity to appeal to the age-impaired, but not reduced in play value.

Spelling With A Twist game designed especially for kids. Using the Coodju Lite Spinner, children will spin their way through fun and zany Spelling Twists like Forwards, Vowels, Consonants and the all-new First & Last Letter. Coodju Lite has 2 different spelling levels, colorful play variations and other surprises make it spell "f-u-n" for everyone!

You and your friends split into teams and battle each other for points by spelling words you use all the time in some bizarre and crazy ways. 
The first team to collect all 5 of their Twist Cards wins the game!

Name: Lenny the Lion's Treasure Hunt
Description:
Players must collect 1 treasure from each 'cave'. Each cave has 4 cards but only the top one is revealed. When a player collects his treasure, he may take the revealed card or the face-down card beneath it. Once you have a Treasure, you must get to 'Home', where it safe. On your journey home, you can be landed on by another player, who then gets you Treasure from you.
Movement is by a die or you can choose to move 2 spaces without a die roll.
The first player to collect 1 Treasure from each cave wins.

Name: The Game of Horoscope
Description: Each player competes to collect 12 cards, one for each sign of the horoscope. At the beginning, you choose a date and there is a reference card that tells six different numbers. Your card collection should total one of those six numbers to win. Movement is by dice but a player always has the option to move 1 space and not throw dice. Good Fortune cards can score additional points and there is interaction because players can take horoscope cards from other players.

Name: Odds-On The new greyhound race game
Description: Players 'invest' their money on which greyhound will win. The greyhound trap number cards are shuffled and the bookmaker takes out some cards. He then offers odds based on the knowledge that some greyhounds will have less cards than other ones. The players now bet. The race is simple. The bookmaker turns over a card and that greyhound moves one space. Then another one is turned and that greyhound (it could be the same one) moves one space. After 6 races, the player with the most money wins.

Name: Le roi du bio
Description: Le roi du bio ("King of organic farming") is a card game where each player manages a farm according to organic farming methods. By adding diversified productions and feeding their pig, players will collect reputation points. The player with the most reputation points wins.

Name: Nightfall: "Shadow Seven" Promo
Description:
Since the Nightfall, the humans have fought a brave battle for the sake of humanity. But it seems to be an endless struggle. For the greater good humans continue the battle and continue to accumulate resistance against the devious creatures of the night.

Shadow Seven introduces a new hunter to the scene. 
The color is: White, and the chaining colors are Red and Purple.

The pack is to be coming pre-wrapped with:

     1 Shadow Seven draft card
     7 Shadow Seven cards


The card divider for this card comes with the Nightfall box.

Name: Autokross-88
Description:
A drifter in Zone's wastelands for many years, the Preacher has finally settled near the Karlsruhe ruins, twenty years after the '68 war, with the promise of the Revelation to the conqueror in a number of trials set for those willing to take part.

People of all ages and backgrounds started pouring in, even from beyond the great Wall, driven by the irresistible urge to have their dreams made true. The pilgrimage, a trial in itself, killed many at the hands of the Scourges or the Infekted, but those who made it are now called the Circle Of the Eighty-Eight, and the Preacher - their shepherd.

The first trial, an unnatural selection process, will comprise of a series of auto races in which the Circle members will drive heavily armed vehicles to the death. With every type of car declared eligible, many in the Eighty-Eight started smuggling in their vehicles from across the Wall while others started tinkering with the Zone’s own war refuse.

Thus begins Autokross-88.

So the last shall be first, and the first last for many be called, but few chosen. The Preacher






Players will choose and control one of the 88ers throughout the Preacher's series of trials. During each crucible, Circle members will have to pick a vehicle and customize it with different offensive/defensive weapons and equipment in an attempt to gain the edge over their rivals. Death racing will take place in the Zone's hexagonal map tile built wastes through hostile weather, Infekted hordes and unscrupulous comrades.

Name: Einfach klasse in Deutsch: Wörter-Wettlauf
Description:
The game consists of cards which contain a word in three ways: 
- the written word
- a version in which each letter is represented by a picture (of an item starting with that letter)
- a picture of the word. 
There are also 26 smaller tiles which show the representative pictures (see above) on one side and the letters on the other.
The three versions are used for different age levels of writing students. 
The cards are put into the box in two piles, so that just one set of information is visible. The active player now has to form the word either from the letters or the pictures. If s/he is correct, s/he can move his/her pawn to the next field of the word's color on a scoring track. Occupied fields are ignored, so there is a certain level of strategy involved. The first player to reach the top field on the track is the winner.

(User sumary by HilkMAN)

Name: Table Speedway
Description:
A table motorcycle racing game, developed by Peter Adolph, the inventor of Subbuteo. The components used Subbuteo style bases, but instead of soccer/football players, the figures depicted were motorcycle riders. The game used a ball baring, launched from a tube, to propel the riders around the track.

This was one of four games in a series. The other games in the series were: Motor Racing, Horse Racing, and Cycle Speedway. Each of the games were very similar, with only a few minor variations to reflect the sport being represented.

According to Peter Upton's website, the advertising copy for the game described gameplay thusly:

"The patented apparatus enables the reproduction of different gear ratios to be selected... Machine somersaults and overslides, Bumping, track records and lap dashes are all contained in the game... as in real Speedway - the rider who can follow the white line and gates successfully is generally the winner"

Name: Table Motor Racing
Description:
One of four games in the Subbuteo racing series, which also included "Table Speedway", and "Horse Racing" and "Cycle Speedway." All were dexterity games, designed by Peter Adolph, the inventor of Subbuteo. They used a ball bearing rolled down a tube to propel a Subbuteo style base around a racing track.

This version of the racing game was an attempt to simulate automobile racing. Like all games in the series, the rules were very similar to those of the parent game, but varied somewhat from those of "Table Speedway" in order to allow for the representation of the sport.

According to Peter Upton, the game variations were as follows:

"The game was played with a minimum of two, and a maximum of six players. So there could be six cars on the track rather than just the four bikes in speedway. The number of cars is divided by the number of drivers (players), so 2 players get 3 cars each, 3 players get 2 cars each, or you could have 4, 5, or 6 players with a car each."

"Drivers drew for positions on the start line. (although there is nothing to stop you from having qualifying laps)"

"A race could consist of one or more laps."

"The different size ball-bearings still signified different gear ratios, but drivers could select any one they wished at their turn. You were not limited to the one you started with"

Name: Subbuteo Horse Racing
Description:
Subbuteo Horse Racing (also simply called "Horse Racing") was the third in the family of Subbuteo racing games, which also included "Table Speedway", "Table Motor Racing", and "Cycle Speedway."

This was a dexterity game. All games in the series used a very similar mechanic: a ball bearing was dropped down a tube and used to propel a playing piece around a racing track. This particular game simulated horse racing, and the pieces were horses and jockeys mounted on Subbuteo style bases. This used the same basic rules as other games in the series, with some variations to account for the sport being represented.

The variations were as follows:

"The race track may be regulation size, or possibly you may care to improvise its shape, but movement areas should not exceed 8" in length. This measurement should be taken on the inside of the track."

"When the horse has reached the distance post (two movement areas before the Winning Post) no horse is allowed to cross directly in front of another horse. If a horse crosses another in this fashion and within this area and subsequently finishes first, second, or third, the jockey on the crossed horse may lodge an objection, which will be automatically sustained. The offending horse is then placed last and the other horses naturally move up to fill the vacant place."

"Once round the track will be a Five Furlong Sprint race. Twice round is regarded as the Derby course, and three times, the St. Leger course."

"Each race may be regarded as complete in itself, or may become part of a series of races known as a Meeting. The winner of a Meeting will be the owner of the horse, or horses securing the largest amount of prize money. Prize money is allotted as follows: Winner £100, Second £60, Third £40."

There were also advanced rules for steeple chasing.
